original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Wednesday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.11 percent or 10.04 points to 9,115.28, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.24 percent or 6.38 points to 2,650.50.
The market generated a turnover of 347 million rupees during 1200 hours.
Sri Lanka’s Parliament has started debates over the International Monetary Fund agreement since April 25.
Top losers during mid day trade were Vallibel One,  Citizens Development Banking and Melstacorp. (Colombo/April26/2023)
